subject: p16409152
History: Weight loss, elevated white count and liver function tests.
Findings: The cardiac silhouette size is normal. The mediastinal contour is unremarkable. There is enlargement of the right hilum suggestive of underlying lymphadenopathy. Multiple nodules are demonstrated throughout both lungs, the largest within the right lung base measuring 25 cm. No focal consolidation, pleural effusion, or pneumothorax is present. There is likely minimal left lower lobe atelectasis. No acute osseous abnormalities are visualized.
Impression: Multiple bilateral pulmonary nodules compatible with metastatic disease. Right hilar enlargement suggestive of underlying lymphadenopathy. CT of the chest is recommended for further evaluation.
